footnotes.text: 1Abraham Lincoln wrote and signed this letter.

2In the spring and summer of 1849, Lincoln received several letters asking him to help
                  Charles H. Constable receive a patronage appointment from PresidentZachary Taylor‘s administration. Constable alsowroteto Lincoln in May 1849, soliciting his assistance in gaining “any Territorial judicial
                  appointment, Government Agency, or a Diplomatic Appointment to any of the South American
                  States or minor Governments.” On May 13, 1849, Lincoln wrote aletter of introductionon Constable’s behalf to Secretary of StateJohn M. Clayton. However, Constable did not receive an appointment.Despite Lincoln’s efforts in this January 13, 1851 letter to James A. Pearce, Constable
                  also did not receive a federal judgeship in theOregon Territory. Later, however, in 1861, he was elected circuit court judge inMarshall, Illinois.Edwin B.
